title: New technique could help regrow tissue lost to periodontal disease

title_detail.value: New technique could help regrow tissue lost to periodontal disease

summary: About half of all Americans will have periodontal disease at some point in their lives. Characterized by inflamed gums and bone loss around teeth, the condition can cause bad breath, toothache, tender gums and, in severe cases, tooth loss. Now, researchers report development of a membrane that helps periodontal tissue regenerate when implanted into the gums of rats.
